{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3330448,"name":null,"username":"mahtrobotics","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/m/f6c823/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-03-11T20:52:08.783Z","cooked":"

Our team has been trying to get trajectory following to work, we think our biggest issue is that our robot pose measuring is completely off. When viewing our pose on advantage scope, the directionality is completely off and the heading rotates almost 360 degrees when we rotate our robot slightly. What’s confusing about this is that looking at the actual degree measurement we get from our IMU, it makes perfect sense, and field-oriented driving, which uses our IMU angle directly works fine. Even when measuring our individual encoder values they make sense, with the exception that some of them are negative when those wheels are reversed from the others. Our swerve code accounts for that, and all our wheels spin the correct direction when driving, and I had assumed that since we give the module poses to our odometry, it would account for that too. Is that not the case, and if so, how would I account for that? Also, I was under the impression that the pose estimator prioritized the IMU heading over the encoder values, so why is our heading so messed up despite the angle making sense?

Can you share your code? Preferably as a link to github or similar.

I suspect you might have a radians vs degrees error somewhere.

mahtrobotics:

When viewing our pose on advantage scope, the directionality is completely off and the heading rotates almost 360 degrees when we rotate our robot slightly.

You probably are sending the rotation in degrees, but you have radians selected in AdvantageScope.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2024-03-12T15:18:21.149Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":60,"readers_count":59,"score":17.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":458299,"topic_slug":"swerve-robot-pose-measuring-issues-encoders-imu","display_username":"Andy Gasser","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":44380,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"7028 - Java Programming Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/swerve-robot-pose-measuring-issues-encoders-imu/458299/3","custom_user_title":"7028 - Java Programming Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3331492,"name":null,"username":"mahtrobotics","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/m/f6c823/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-03-12T20:11:15.940Z","cooked":"

We are getting a rotation2d directly from our IMU (Pigeon 2) so we’re not sure how we could have a degree to radian error. We additionally created a pose with just 0’s for our translation 2d and the Rotation2d from the IMU and put that on advantage scope and that had the same issues as our actual SwervePoseEstimator. Is there something about advantage scope that we are missing? We thought since only rotation2ds were involved units would not matter. I’m also curious if there are any good ways of viewing our pose other than advantage scope.
